string-array.item: Grilled Pizza
Pasta
Torta

string-array.name: decs
string-array.item: Pizza dough made from scratch is topped with mozzarella cheese, sauce, and your choice of savory toppings, then grilled to perfection for a fun outdoor treat.
Pasta is popular dishes from Italian. You can include almost any vegetables you have in your fridge in this recipe. It is popular even with those who normally scorn vegetarian food.
This savory pie is served at room temperature. Two teaspoons dried basil may be substituted for fresh basil. Use ham or prosciutto ham.

string-array.name: bahan1
string-array.item: Three and a half cups all-purpose flour, or as needed
One third cup olive oil
Two and a quater cups all-purpose flour

string-array.name: bahan2
string-array.item: One envelope Fleischmann's Pizza Crust Yeast
Two tablespoons red wine vinegar
Three quarter cup cornmeal

string-array.name: bahan3
string-array.item: One tablespoon sugar
One teaspoon dried basil
a half of teaspoon salt

string-array.name: bahan4
string-array.item: One and a half teaspoons salt
One teaspoon dried oregano
Three quarter cup butter, diced

string-array.name: bahan5
string-array.item: One and one third cups very warm water (120 degrees to 130 degrees F)
salt and pepper to taste
Two eggs

string-array.name: bahan6
string-array.item: Pizza sauce
One red bell pepper, chopped
Four tablespoons cold water

string-array.name: bahan7
string-array.item: Shredded mozzarella cheese
One green bell pepper, chopped
One and a half of cups ricotta cheese

string-array.name: bahan8
string-array.item: Additional oil for grilling
Two cloves garlic and carrots, minced.
Four ounces feta cheese

string-array.name: bahan9
string-array.item: Additional flour for rolling
Four cups uncooked rotini pasta.
One (10 ounce) package frozen chopped spinach, thawed and drained

string-array.name: bahansep
string-array.item: A half (16 ounce) of jar roasted red peppers, drained and patted dry

string-array.name: step1
string-array.item: Start charcoal fire or preheat gas grill to medium-high heat.
Mix together the oil, vinegar, basil, oregano, salt and pepper. Set aside.

Mix flour, cornmeal, and salt in a bowl. Cut in butter with pastry blender until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Beat 2 eggs with 3 tablespoons cold water; stir into flour mixture until dough holds together. Add another tablespoon water if needed. Shape 2/3 of the dough into flattened round; repeat with remaining 1/3. Wrap. Refrigerate at least 30 minutes, or until firm enough to roll.

string-array.name: step2
string-array.item: Combine 2 cups flour, undissolved yeast, sugar and salt in a large bowl. Add very warm water and oil; mix until well blended, about 1 minute. Gradually add enough flour to make a soft dough. Dough should form a ball and will be slightly sticky. Knead** on a floured surface, adding additional flour if necessary, until smooth and elastic but not sticky, about 5 minutes.
Bring a large pot of salted water to boil; add rotini and bring to a boil again. Cook until rotini is al dente; drain well. Return the rotini to the pot.
In another bowl, combine ricotta cheese, crumbled feta, Parmesan cheese, 1 egg, parsley, basil, and oregano until well blended.

string-array.name: step3
string-array.item: Divide dough into 8 portions. Pat or roll dough on a well-floured counter to about 8-inch circles; they do not need to be perfect. Brush both sides of crust with additional oil. Using hands, lift each crust carefully and place on grill. Cook for 3 to 4 minutes until bottom is lightly browned and top looks set. Using long handled tongs, remove crust from grill, grilled side up, to a platter or baking sheet.

While rotini is cooking heat oil in a frying pan and saute red bell pepper, green bell pepper, garlic and carrots. Cook until vegetables are softened. Place the broccoli in the frying pan and cook another 2 minutes.

Have an 8 or 9 inch springform pan ready. On a lightly floured surface, roll out the larger portion of dough into a 15 inch diameter circle. Carefully place in ungreased pan; press lightly against bottom and sides. Trim overhanging dough to 1 inch from pan rim.

string-array.name: step4
string-array.item: Lightly add sauce and top the grilled side of each pizza crust. Excess sauce or toppings makes the pizza hard to handle. Repeat with remaining pizzas. Carefully slide each pizza onto the grill. Cook an additional 3 to 4 minutes until bottom of crust is browned and cheese is melted. Remove from grill and serve immediately.
Pour the cooked vegetables into the pot with the pasta. Pour the vinaigrette over the pasta and vegetables. Toss to distribute vegetables and vinaigrette evenly.

Scatter half of the mozzarella over the bottom of the crust. Next arrange half the ham slices in an even layer. Spread with ricotta cheese mixture, then sprinkle with spinach. Cover with the remaining ham slices. Press down gently to pack layers. Add red peppers in a single layer, and top with the remaining mozzarella. Press down again.

string-array.name: step5
string-array.item: Roll out remaining dough to 8 or 9 inch circle. Place over filling to cover. Moisten edges, and seal crusts together. Crimp or flute edges. Crust should not extend above pan rim. Beat remaining egg, and brush over the crust. Cut several small vents in top crust for steam to escape.

string-array.name: step6
string-array.item: Bake at 375 degrees F (190 degrees C) for 1 hour, or until crust is deep golden brown and pulls away from sides. Cool in pan on wire rack 45 minutes. Remove pan sides; cool completely. Cut into 12 wedges. Serve at room temperature.
